Manhattan Active® Allocation Release Notes 21.2

 

  • Manhattan Active® Allocation Release Notes 21.2
    • Size Profile Optimization
    • Restrict Allocation based on Clearance/Markdown
    • Auto Approval & Release
    • UI for Simple Method Configuration
    • Allocation Maintenance for All Sizes
    • Need Segmentation by Fulfillment Adjustments
    • Allocation Maintenance - Export to Excel
    • Mass Change Allocation
    • Model Store and Model Product
    • Product and Location Hierarchies
    • Master Data Changes

Manhattan Active® Allocation enables you to effectively distribute merchandise inventory to the stores by allowing flexibility to define the store needs as per your business requirements.

The 21.2 release of Manhattan Active Allocation delivers solution enhancements across our Omni-centric allocation capabilities including product & location modeling, managing hierarchies, mass update of records, and automatic approvals for allocation requests.

 

Size Profile Optimization

Users can generate size profiles for styles or categories of products that summarize the relative sales of the various sizes. Allocation can use these size profiles and the current inventory at a location to automatically select the optimal combination of pre-packs to allocate to a store.

 

Restrict Allocation based on Clearance/Markdown

Inventory is not allocated to any product locations that are on markdown.

A new attribute ‘Markdown%’ is added to the Product Location page in the UI to indicate whether it is on markdown.

 

Auto Approval & Release

Users can now create Auto Submit-Approval Policies which allow the allocations of supplies that meet certain criteria to be submitted or approved automatically. 

 

UI for Simple Method Configuration

Users can now define need computation methods based on a single metric in the UI.  The ability to create more complex methods using the text editor is still available. 

 

Allocation Maintenance for All Sizes

Allocations for the same style-color but different sizes which are not in a pre-pack can now be reviewed, submitted, and approved together in Allocation Maintenance. 

 

Need Segmentation by Fulfillment Adjustments

Fulfillment adjustments defined in the strategy add to the need quantity calculated by the method. 

Total need (retail need + fulfillment adjustments) can now be seen as a bar chart by retail/fulfillment type in View Metrics > By Size and Color chart.

 

Allocation Maintenance - Export to Excel

Users can export the allocation results to excel. A new button is added to the Allocation Maintenance page. Clicking on this button will download a CSV file of allocation results.

 

Mass Change Allocation

Users can perform mass updates to the allocation quantities for multiple selected locations in a single action. A new button is added to the Allocation Maintenance screen.

The following updates are supported:

  • Add
  • Subtract
  • Replace
  • Increase By (Percentage)
  • Decrease By (Percentage)
  • Minimum
  • Maximum

 

Model Store and Model Product

Users can define model stores and model products for newly launched stores and products respectively. The metrics from the existing stores/products can be used by the engine to compute the need variable for allocating inventory to the new stores/products.

Users can view these model metrics in the View Metrics window.

 

Product and Location Hierarchies

Users can create and edit the product and location hierarchies and the levels for these hierarchies.

 

Master Data Changes

Users can now create product locations at aggregate levels like style and style-color. This is supported only for styled products. 

Non-styled products have product locations at leaf level only.
